intro: Heterosmilax borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean arrowroot, is a climbing plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its tuberous roots, which are used in traditional medicine. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, greenish flowers that are followed by berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of tropical forests. Due to its medicinal properties and limited distribution, it is considered a valuable but threatened species.
